newsitem.title: USA: Court orders CA to return software.
newsitem.headline: Court orders CA to return software.

text.p: A New York appellate court has upheld a Supreme Court ruling obliging Computer Associates International Inc to return a software product to its developers.

The developers of the software DataVantage also said in a statement that the ruling ordered Computer Associates to pay them more than $12 million as part of an arbitration award that was entered last year.
They said the arbitration panel had found that Computer Associates had fraudulently concealed transactions to avoid paying royalties to them for the software.
DataVantage allows computer programmers and data base administrators to create, save, modify and restructure data.
